title: Lighter caponata
time: Hands-on time 10 min, oven time 35-40 min
description: Our lighter take on the classic Sicilian dish is less than 250 calories per serving – perfect if you’re following the 5:2 diet. For a heartier meal, serve with crusty ciabatta bread or stir through pasta as a fantastic vegetable-based sauce.
ingredients: 6 plum tomatoes, roughly chopped (or use a 400g can of chopped tomatoes)
80g large pitted green olives (we used gordal, in a cumin and lemon dressing), sliced
20g fresh basil, leaves picked and roughly torn
1 tbsp pine nuts, lightly toasted in a dry pan (optional)

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. Put the aubergines, onionand celery in a baking dish or shallow roasting tin. Lightly spray with the cooking oil, season generously with salt and ground black pepper and toss well. Roast the vegetables for 25 minutes.

method.Step 2: Stir in the tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, vinegar and dried marjoram/oregano, then return to the oven for a further 10-15 minutes.

method.Step 3: Stir in the olives, capers, raisins and most of the basil, then serve scattered with a few toasted pine nuts and the remaining basil leaves.
